item.title: Wednesday finance with Alan Kohler
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Mate Stipinovich, Aristides Avlontis, Karl Whitburn jailed for bungled Albany drug smuggling attempt
item.description: Three men forced to cling to an esky to survive in wild seas off Albany as they tried to import hundreds of kilograms of cocaine into Western Australia are described by a judge as "Keystone criminals" at their sentencing.

item.title: How worried should we be about microplastics in our homes?
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: What the critical minerals deal means for Australia
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: Australia continues dominance against England as Sutherland and Gardner put on monster stand
item.description: Australia is rescued by an incredible stand between Ash Gardner and Annabel Sutherland at the Women's World Cup.

item.title: Supreme Court in Brisbane reserves decision on Queensland's puberty blocker freeze after legal challenge
item.description: The mother of a trans teenager launched legal action over the state's freeze on puberty blockers earlier this year.

item.title: Diamonds dominate Silver Ferns to take 2-0 lead in Constellation Cup series
item.description: Australia is one win away from regaining the Constellation Cup after dominating New Zealand in the second netball Test match in Sydney.

item.title: AC Milan Serie A game will be played in Perth despite backlash, deputy premier says
item.description: The state government is doubling down on its plan to bring European football heavyweights AC Milan to Perth to play a historic Italian league game, despite significant backlash from fans and players.

item.title: Serbian president labels shooting and fire outside parliament building a 'terrorist act'
item.description: One person has been detained and at least one person injured after a shooting and a fire broke out outside of Serbia's parliament in Belgrade, in an incident that President Aleksandar Vučić has called a terrorist act.

item.title: Sir Keir Starmer backs calls for parliamentary inquiry into Prince Andrew's Royal Lodge lease deal
item.description: Sir Keir Starmer has told British parliament he supports scrutiny of Crown property deals but getting Prince Andrew to answer questions at Westminster might not be easy.

item.title: Trump seems relaxed about Taiwan and analysts are concerned
item.description: There was something Donald Trump said that alarmed strategic analysts. And it had nothing to do with disliking Kevin Rudd.

item.title: Luna Park machete brawl accused free on bail after alleged St Kilda attack
item.description: Three men charged over a machete brawl outside Melbourne's Luna Park have been freed on bail, despite police urging magistrates to keep the trio locked up.

item.title: The move to break China's iron grip on world's supply of critical minerals
item.description: America dominates the global financial system. The Middle East controls energy. And China, during the past 40 years, has created a vice-like grip on the mining, refining and production of global metals.

item.title: As Europe proposes a ban on all PFAS, some researchers say Australia should do the same
item.description: As the European Union proposes a ban on the entire PFAS chemical class, some researchers say Australia should do the same.

item.title: Where Matildas coach Joe Montemurro wants to take the team and women's football
item.description: Matildas coach Joe Montemurro has no shortage of ideas or passion for how to reshape women's football in Australia, and it's a contrast from his predecessor.

item.title: Seafood has undeserved reputation as source of microplastic exposure, scientists say
item.description: There are microplastics in almost everything, so why does seafood get such a bad reputation? Scientists say it is down to disproportionate research and media attention.

item.title: 'Localised extinction' risk for seagrass in Botany Bay
item.description: It is estimated half of the local seagrass habitat in Gamay (Botany Bay) has already been lost. Researchers and Aboriginal rangers are replanting seagrass fragments and using biochar to restore the area.

item.title: Amid a small investor rush on precious metals, have the gold and silver bubbles popped?
item.description: Precious metal prices have been pushing record highs and, as queues lengthened outside bullion traders, gold and silver prices suddenly fell back. But positive signs remain, analysts say.

item.title: Why mpox cases in Australia in 2025 are a fraction of what they were last year
item.description: Mpox transmission surged between July to September last year, but there have been far fewer cases recorded in 2025.

item.title: After 37 years, mystery still surrounds the death of Mark Haines
item.description: Some key questions about the death of Indigenous teenager Mark Haines are still unanswered after a coronial inquest spanning five weeks.

item.title: Oscar Piastri confident in F1 championship battle against Lando Norris and Max Verstappen in Mexico
item.description: This year may be the first time in F1 that Oscar Piastri has been under the cosh of a title fight, but it is not the first time he has been in a three-way fight for a championship.

item.title: ICJ rules Israel must allow aid groups unimpeded access to Gaza
item.description: The International Court of Justice rules Israel must allow aid groups access to Gaza and that the nation's attempts to stop a UN agency delivering aid to Palestinians are illegal.

item.title: Russia jails teen musicians for viral anti-Kremlin song performance amid censorship crackdown
item.description: An ongoing censorship crackdown in Russia sees a teenage band jailed after a performance of an anti-Kremlin song went viral, but the protest keeps growing.

item.title: Brazen crime and protest clashes have made Melbourne's CBD less safe, traders say
item.description: Business owners say recent incidents — including a random daylight stabbing and clashes between protesters and police — are deterring customers from the heart of the Victorian capital.

item.title: How a climate adaptation 'shortfall' is being felt in northern Australia
item.description: Shaded and green spaces can be hard to find in northern towns and cities where summer temperatures regularly surpass 40 degrees Celsius.

item.title: Designer Amy Lawrance's new collection Total Recall is a mix of medieval and sci-fi
item.description: Award-winning fashion designer Amy Lawrance blends 90s sci-fi with the medieval in her new collection, Total Recall.

item.title: Masses of NT prison rehabilitation sessions cancelled as prisoner numbers surge
item.description: As the Northern Territory prison population continues to reach all-time highs, data reveals a majority of the NT's rehab program are being cancelled more often than they are being delivered.

item.title: Claims foster care payments have been cut spark concern for kids with complex needs
item.description: Foster carers in Victoria say sudden allowance reductions for children with complex needs have left them feeling "undervalued and confused".

item.title: South Energy plans 100-megawatt battery project for Victoria's Macedon Ranges
item.description: A proposed energy storage facility in Macedon could power thousands of homes — but not everyone is convinced it is being built in the right place.

item.title: 'Daughter's promise' inspires Darkinyung dictionary to revive sleepy language
item.description: With the help of a linguist and her community, Aunty Bronwyn Chambers has revitalised a sleepy language.

item.title: Mount Stirling Resort financial deficit prompts review of winter operations
item.description: The managing body of Victoria's six alpine resorts says it is reviewing winter operations at its Mount Stirling resort, which has been "operating at a financial deficit" for some time.

item.title: KAPCO deal with NT abattoir to supply communities with affordable Kimberley beef
item.description: A cattle company in Western Australia's Kimberley has struck a deal with a Northern Territory abattoir to get local beef to consumers in remote communities.

item.title: Waroona weighs up planned gallium refinery funded by US-Australia critical minerals deal
item.description: Locals in the WA community of Waroona are welcoming a US-Australia deal set to build a new rare earth refinery south of Perth, but others warn the project will further entrench mining interests.

item.title: Australia's first fluorite mine faces 'deep opposition' from Kimberley traditional owners
item.description: Traditional owners have raised cultural and environmental concerns about a proposed fluorite mine in Western Australia's remote Kimberley region.

item.title: Louvre chief blames CCTV gaps for $150m jewellery heist
item.description: The Louvre chief says she repeatedly raised concerns about CCTV coverage at the museum, only for her fears to come "horribly true".

item.title: Queensland's hobby gold-diggers under threat from law giving veto power to miners
item.description: Gold prospectors are being locked out of some fossicking areas by a new law that allows mining companies with pending leases to say no.

item.title: More Australian-grown coffee to become available as industry grows
item.description: The Australian coffee industry is growing as new varieties become available and local demand increases.

item.title: Criticism over rodenticide review delays as study finds poison in northern quolls
item.description: Rat bait poison has been found in threatened northern quoll populations as an overdue report into their use by the federal pesticides regulator is again delayed.

item.title: Mapping rare earth supplies and the challenges of turning these minerals into magnets
item.description: Unlike the name suggests, rare earths are not very rare at all. The critical minerals are found in abundance in many countries, but being big on reserves may not mean big business.

item.title: US hits Russia's biggest oil firms with sanctions over Ukraine
item.description: The White House makes a sharp move to pressure Moscow to secure peace in Ukraine just one day after a summit between US President Donald Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin falls apart.

item.title: Funky animal hairdos and a smoking duck among 2025 Comedy Wildlife Photo Awards finalists
item.description: The 40 shortlisted images pair talented nature photography with humour that often relies on capturing a moment at just the right time.

item.title: State of Origin battleground experience a bonus for Kangaroos against England in Ashes trilogy
item.description: The Ashes clash with England is a three-Test contest and Origin rivals Nathan Cleary and Harry Grant believe experience in the state head-to-head could be telling.

item.title: Two teenage boys stabbed, one with a screwdriver, during alleged daylight brawl in Broadmeadows
item.description: Two teenage boys were hospitalised with stab wounds after an alleged brawl between two groups armed with a screwdriver and possibly a machete at a train station in Broadmeadows on Wednesday.

item.title: Queensland coach Johan Botha baffles Cricketers' Association with stance on injured players being paid
item.description: Australian Cricketers' Association boss Paul Marsh will seek clarification from Queensland coach Johan Botha over his comments regarding player payments.

item.title: Jack Bowd pleads not guilty to Newell Highway crash that killed four people
item.description: A 23-year-old pleads not guilty to dangerous driving and drink driving charges after a crash that claimed the lives of two friends and a husband and wife last year.

item.title: Coles to appear at Kumanjayi White coronial inquest after Alice Springs death in custody
item.description: Supermarket giant Coles is among the parties expected to take part in a coronial inquest into the death in custody of a young Aboriginal man inside its Alice Springs shop earlier this year.

item.title: Australia's institutions are what make us freaking amazing
item.description: The world changes, yet Australia keeps being great. Our institutions permit us to be nimble, and we adapt.

item.title: Australia beats India in second ODI in Adelaide to clinch three-game series
item.description: Australia completes a two-wicket win over India, clinching the three-game ODI series as Cooper Connolly and Mitch Owen combine to lead Australia's run chase.

item.title: Backlash over Bureau of Meteorology's 'confusing' new website
item.description: As wild weather wreaked havoc across the country, the Bureau of Meteorology launched a new website.

item.title: Stop-work action to affect Tasmanian public schools and health services next week
item.description: Unions are unhappy with the state government's latest public sector pay offer and are planning stop-work actions next week. Schools and health services for non-urgent patients could be affected.

item.title: What a film reviewer who is also a twin thinks of Twinless
item.description: Montearo Brown is a TV and film reviewer who blogs under the name Sprite Lee. He also happens to be a twin. So, what does he think of the movie Twinless?

item.title: Police pursuit Kununurra
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Group of juveniles accused of chasing Kununurra police in stolen cars, with video posted online
item.description: A video of an erratically driven vehicle chasing a police car in Kununurra has been posted on social media.

item.title: North Queensland health authorities issue warning over flying foxes after more exposures
item.description: An increase in people being injured by bats sparks a health warning over the deadly Australian bat lyssavirus.

item.title: Coalition sours over proposed reform to 'broken' environment laws
item.description: Optimism that a deal can be found to amend Australia's environment laws fades, as the Coalition raises concerns over details just days after parts of the legislation were shared with stakeholders.

item.title: Artificial nests trial underway to save Queensland's endangered palm cockatoo
item.description: Few birds have nesting requirements as finicky as Australia's largest parrot, the palm cockatoo, which is facing its own housing crisis due to a shortage of breeding habitat.

item.title: Developers want to double the height of Woden, but the Territory Plan says no
item.description: A developer wants to add 17 towers to the Woden town centre with the highest proposed to stand at 55 storeys.

item.title: Central Land Council boss testifies against senator Jacinta Nampijinpa Price in Federal Court defamation trial
item.description: Central Land Council chief executive Lesley Turner — who is suing Jacinta Nampijinpa Price for defamation — testifies in Federal Court, and denies being "embarrassed" by the senator pointing out alleged "failures" of the council.

item.title: Why have protesters clashed with police in Dublin?
item.description: The head of the Irish police service condemns what he has called "thuggery" by "a mob intent on violence".

item.title: Hanson rubbishes Joyce leadership speculation, Albanese gets two thumbs up
item.description: This week in politics Barnaby Joyce became a "free agent" and the PM's meeting with Donald Trump got two thumbs up.

item.title: Ways to reduce pollen and dust at home this allergy and hayfever season
item.description: Hayfever symptoms can be debilitating. Experts give their tips and tricks on helping reduce allergens in the home.

item.title: Promised police beat to tackle Burleigh 'thugs' but acting mayor questions limited hours
item.description: The state government says a promised police beat in Burleigh Heads will be operating by the end of the year, but the acting mayor has questioned why it won't be open at night or on weekends.

item.title: Trump administration conducts military strikes on suspected drug-courier boats in the Pacific
item.description: The Trump administration has expanded its target area in its 'narco-trafficking' offensive, conducting two military strikes in the Pacific and bringing the death toll from its attacks to at least 37.

item.title: Two senior Optus executives depart as scrutiny over recent major triple-0 outage continues
item.description: Optus confirms two of its senior executives will step down as it continues to face scrutiny over a recent major triple-0 outage.

item.title: Spotted-tail quoll discovered at Coffs Harbour marina amid rewilding effort
item.description: An unusual sighting of a spotted-tailed quoll at a boat marina has surprised residents and prompted parks and wildlife experts to monitor the usually forest-dwelling creature.

item.title: Sport has a role to play in addressing harmful gender stereotypes, says Carlton defender
item.description: Carlton defender Harriet Cordner says sport has a key role to play in challenging gendered stereotypes in society, particularly given its reach within communities.

item.title: Temporary commercial and recreational fishing restrictions announced amid ongoing algal bloom
item.description: The SA government is placing temporary restrictions on fishing in the Gulf St Vincent and Spencer Gulf as results from fish stock monitoring show declining numbers of some species.

item.title: High speed camera captures how venomous snakes bite
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Homicide investigation underway after Queensland police find man dead on southern Gold Coast
item.description: Queensland police say it is believed the two men are known to each other and there is no threat to the community.

item.title: Phillip Mark Walton's family tell inquest of their heartbreak about his death in custody
item.description: The family of a man who died in police custody in northern New South Wales say they thought he had overcome his problems.

item.title: Chinese Communist Party body replaces 11 members amid corruption purge
item.description: The personnel turnover is the highest since 2017 and shows Xi's determination to crack down on corruption, say analysts.

item.title: King Charles and Pope Leo pray together in Vatican's Sistine Chapel
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Vodafone customer unable to ring triple-0 with Samsung phone says telco failed to help her fix problem
item.description: A Vodafone customer who was repeatedly unable to ring triple-0 says the major telco failed to help her fix the problem for months.

item.title: Melbourne crime prevention program provides mentoring for multicultural youth
item.description: Lueth Akue turned to crime during a childhood plagued by hardship. He is using his experience to help young offenders turn their lives around in Australia's "crime capital".

item.title: Coalition's climate strategy could learn from the proverb about a dog returning to its vomit
item.description: The Liberals have faced an existential crisis over climate and energy twice in recent memory. The damage must live in the memory of today's parliamentarians, who face the prospect of another episode.

item.title: The Dish still helping unravel secrets of the cosmos 25 years after film's release
item.description: The film The Dish helped reintroduce a new generation of Australians to the critical role the Parkes Observatory played in the Moon landing. Twenty-five years after its release, the film has had a lasting impact.

item.title: How to tell if a book is valuable
item.description: There are many factors that can determine the monetary value of a book, so what can make an edition worth tens of thousands of dollars?

item.title: Donald Trump's trade moves with China put South-East Asian countries in the crossfire
item.description: As US President Donald Trump visits South-East Asia amid global trade tensions, Indonesian exporters worry the region could bear the brunt of his protectionist policies.

item.title: Women push for flexible construction jobs amid building delays in NSW
item.description: Experts say unlocking flexible hours, gender diversity and migrant workers could help Australia meet its housing targets.

item.title: Australia is all in on AUKUS. In Donald Trump's America, it's more complicated
item.description: In Washington on Monday, Anthony Albanese made something clear once again: Australia is all-in on the trilateral defence pact. Clarifying what US powerbrokers think remains a multi-billion-dollar question.

item.title: Traditional owners handed more than 900,000ha of Cape York land after 255 years
item.description: A native title claim in the region where Captain James Cook made landfall after his ship crashed into the Great Barrier Reef in 1770 is among one of three to finally be settled by the Federal Court this week.

item.title: Three men charged with murder of Bankstown woman Thi Kim Tran
item.description: Three men have been charged with murder after a Sydney woman was kidnapped and killed over her husband's drug debt earlier this year.

item.title: Parliamentary privilege used to name Cheryl Grimmer murder confessor, but legal limits remain
item.description: NSW MP Jeremy Buckingham used parliamentary privilege to read a 1971 confession in the Cheryl Grimmer case, bypassing decades of legal silence. Outside parliament, the man's identity remains legally suppressed.

item.title: NSW program helps mothers restore dignity, rebuild lives outside of prison
item.description: The program from the Women's and Girls' Emergency Centre helps pregnant women in, or at risk of incarceration find safe accommodation and keep families together.

item.title: Queensland government announces pilot program to subsidise apprenticeships, but industry warns more needed
item.description: The Queensland government has announced a pilot program which would subsidies the wages of about 7 per cent of the state's apprentices if taken on by eligible businesses.

item.title: ASX closes Friday lower but hits second consecutive week of gains, Trump terminates trade talks with Canada — as it happened
item.description: The Australian share market finishes Friday lower but the week higher after Tuesday's record gains, as US President Donald Trump takes to social media to declare trade negotiations with Canada over.

item.title: Sydney 2000 Paralympics changed everything for the Paralympic movement
item.description: Sydney 2000 was a turning point — not just for me, but for the entire Paralympic movement, writes silver medallist Elizabeth Wright.

item.title: NBA head coach Chauncey Billups, player Terry Rozier arrested over sports betting
item.description: Portland coach Chauncey Billups and Miami Heat guard Terry Rozier are among more than 30 people arrested in two cases alleging sprawling criminal schemes to rake in millions by rigging sports bets and poker games.

item.title: Innovators rethink bike seat design to combat cycling saddle pain
item.description: "Saddle soreness" is a common complaint among cyclists. These innovators are looking at creative ways to prevent it by redesigning the bike seat.

item.title: ADHD support groups help women in Geraldton navigate life after diagnosis
item.description: Jessie Carrie could not find the support she needed after being diagnosed with ADHD as an adult, so she started groups to help others.

item.title: Mudgee's Regent Theatre bought by residents with big plans for grand revival
item.description: After sitting idle for two decades residents of the NSW town of Mudgee have purchased the iconic Regent Theatre, with plans to return it to its former glory.

item.title: Construction sector taskforce investigate burglary at home of investigative journalist
item.description: Victoria Police are investigating a burglary at the home of award-winning journalist Nick McKenzie.

item.title: Dolphins frolic with sea sponges on heads in unique mating tactic off WA coast
item.description: Scientists observe male humpback dolphins parading sea sponges on their heads to impress females off Western Australia's northern coast.

item.title: New deep cave diving doco features Thai cave rescue hero Richard Harris
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Australia backs Pacific Islands facing China heat over Taiwan
item.description: Beijing reprimanded Pacific Island nation ambassadors for including Taiwan in the regional summit last month, but Australia and New Zealand have lent their support.

item.title: Fashion Critical reveals her favourite red carpet 'lewks'
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Deadly H5 strain of bird flu suspected on sub-Antarctic Heard Island in the Southern Ocean
item.description: Suspected bird flu has reached Australia's sub-Antarctic Heard Island, with signs of the deadly H5 avian disease observed in elephant seals.

item.title: What we know about 'mind-boggling' NBA rigging and poker fraud cases
item.description: The allegations involve NBA luminaries, multiple New York mafia families, millions in cash and even an x-ray poker table that could read cards face down.

item.title: A-League footballers' mental health and substance abuse concerns revealed in PFA report
item.description: Socceroos hero Andrew Redmayne sheds light on the stresses A-League players face after a report finds footballers are struggling with their mental health, substance abuse and job security issues.

item.title: US imposes more sanctions on Russia as Ukraine war continues
item.description: The Russian president acknowledged that the move to sanction two oil companies would have "certain consequences", but would not significantly impact the country's economy.

item.title: Man charged over stabbing death of housemate on southern Gold Coast
item.description: A 27-year-old man has faced court on the Gold Coast, charged with murder after his 57-year-old housemate was found dead with stab wounds at a unit.

item.title: India qualifies for Women's World Cup semifinal after double-century partnership from opening pair
item.description: Smriti Mandhana scores her third century of the World Cup as a monster partnership with fellow opener Pratika Rawal delivers India a crucial win against New Zealand.

item.title: Survivor calls for greater awareness of strokes in young people
item.description: Despite one in four sufferers being under 65, experts say there is a common misconception that strokes only occur in older people. Mental well-being is key to recovery but is often more difficult for younger stroke survivors.

item.title: World Rowing hits back at green light claims for Olympic Games rowing on Fitzroy River
item.description: The world's top rowing and canoeing bodies say they are conducting their own assessments of the Fitzroy River ahead of the 2032 Games despite Queensland politicians insisting events will be held there.

item.title: First Nations women share healing stories to pave bright tourism future
item.description: A growing number of women are entering the in-demand cultural tourism field in which First Nations guides share treasured knowledge.

item.title: Injury status of LeBron James and other NBA stars allegedly used in betting scandal
item.description: The injury status of the likes of LeBron James and Anthony Davis was allegedly passed on to gamblers in the scandal that has rocked the NBA.

item.title: Cranky crow forces visitors to Noosa's Hastings Street to duck for cover
item.description: Noosa Council has received multiple reports of the crow swooping walkers, which experts say is unusual for the species.

item.title: Ex-employees accuse Kimberley service station of hygiene breaches
item.description: Steve Pates has worked in kitchens all around Australia, but says what he witnessed at a business in WA's far north was beyond anything he had ever seen.

item.title: From phishing to investment cons: How to spot a scam and safeguard your savings
item.description: From phishing to investment cons, scammers are staying "one step ahead" in their efforts to separate us from our savings. Older Australians are often targeted, but there are steps you can take to protect yourself, and those you care about.

item.title: Northern Territory, Queensland swelter through heatwaves
item.description: Temperatures are set to reach above 40 degrees in some places, with more hospital admissions likely because of heat-related illness.

item.title: Kangaroo Nawaqanitawase will earn Wallabies recall in 2027, says Les Kiss
item.description: Wallabies coach-in-waiting Les Kiss is an admirer of Kangaroos debutant Mark Nawaqanitawase, who he says will return to union in 2027 wiser and a better player.

item.title: Dezi Freeman search 'far from over' as new taskforce continues investigation
item.description: Mount Buffalo National Park will open to everyone as Victoria Police's search for Dezi Freeman continues with the creation of a new taskforce.

item.title: Staff in regional ACM newsrooms concerned about rollout of generative AI model
item.description: Staff and a union say a generative AI model being tested in Australian Community Media's regional newspapers is misattributing facts and leaving some fearing for their jobs.

item.title: Australia claims silver in team pursuit at UCI track world championships in Santiago
item.description: Australia's team pursuit squad and keirin rider Leigh Hoffman have both claimed silver medals on day two of the UCI track world championships in Santiago, Chile.

item.title: Police warn wave of kill crew plots break 'no families' gangland code
item.description: The alleged murder of a woman who was stripped naked, bound and gagged before she was killed shows a wider trend that Sydney's "guns for hire" are willing to break gangland code, a senior NSW detective says.

item.title: Man hit by cane train suffers serious leg injury in far north Queensland
item.description: A 30-year-old man is flown to hospital with life-threatening injuries after being struck by a cane train in Tully, south of Cairns.

item.title: Mount Gibson announces 450 redundancies due to Koolan Island mine closure
item.description: A rockfall prompts Mount Gibson Iron to wind down operations at its Koolan Island mine in WA's far north earlier than expected, with 450 workers made redundant.

item.title: Suspected arson attack on Bega home, weeks after fatal stabbing on same street
item.description: A fire that destroyed a house on the NSW far south coast is being treated as suspicious, after a man was fatally stabbed on the same street earlier in the month.

item.title: Woman charged with murder, arson over Gladstone house fire in central Queensland
item.description: A woman has been charged with murder and arson after a house fire that took the lives of a woman and two young children in Gladstone.

item.title: Video appears to show Louvre jewel thieves escaping on ladder in broad daylight
item.description: Video shared widely on social media appears to show alleged Louvre jewellery thieves escaping on a crane near the Seine.

item.title: Donna Manton says sexual violence does not discriminate
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: ADF facing landmark class action over alleged systemic sexual violence, harassment and discrimination
item.description: The class action, which was officially launched in the Federal Court on Friday, will operate on an opt-out basis.

item.title: Kate says she was broken by a series of incidents, including a threat by her superior.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Rare dinosaur mummies help scientists recreate what the prehistoric creatures may have looked like
item.description: The duck-billed dinosaur was only a few years old when it died. Scientists now believe the species had hooves on its feet.

item.title: Police launch fresh search in cold case murder of Colleen Walker-Craig
item.description: A search is underway on NSW Mid North Coast for the remains of Colleen Walker-Craig, who went missing within months of two other children in Bowraville.

item.title: US faces a reckoning after blurring line between gambling and sport
item.description: Seven years ago, the United States crossed a line that it once dared to never cross, leading to a string of arrests that threaten to tarnish sports in the country for generations to come.

item.title: Andrew Forrest's $1b Clarke Creek Wind Farm opens in central Queensland
item.description: After three years of construction, one of the biggest wind farms in the country has been switched on. The large-scale project has not been without controversy.

item.title: Canada ready to resume US trade talks halted by Trump over TV ad
item.description: The US president has used tariffs as leverage on many countries around the world.

item.title: Senator Nampijinpa Price testifies in defamation trial brought by land council boss
item.description: Senator Jacinta Nampijinpa Price testifies in her own Federal Court defamation trial in Darwin, following cross-examination from the head of the Central Land Council.

item.title: How these families organise cooking to make weeknight dinners easier
item.description: Precision meal planning is not for every household and these family cooks say there are other ways to make mealtimes easier.

item.title: Satellite images show White House's East Wing has been demolished for Donald Trump's ballroom
item.description: The demolition has sparked angry backlash from Democrats and raised questions about whether the Trump administration followed proper protocols.

item.title: Childcare workers charged after allegedly assaulting toddler at Little Zak's Academy in Western Sydney
item.description: Little Zak's Academy said it had "zero tolerance" for any conduct that compromised the wellbeing of a child.

item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Fish at Murujuga
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Australia's women on cusp of International Crown semifinals as Minjee Lee, Steph Kyriacou fight back
item.description: Minjee Lee and Steph Kyriacou edge a star-studded Team Australia closer to the semifinals at the prestigious International Crown in Seoul.

item.title: Woman extradited to Queensland over alleged Chinese authority and law enforcement impersonation scam
item.description: Police say they've been investigating reports about scammers impersonating Chinese police officers or authority figures.

item.title: Friday Finance with David Chau
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: WA company TLC Surface Treatment fined almost $1m over death of 16yo Hamiora Sharland
item.description: A sandblasting and spray-painting business is fined more than $1 million over the death of a teenager who was critically injured at a Perth factory.

item.title: Graeme Samuel says he's "disappointed" with Sussan Ley.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Environment report author 'bitterly disappointed' by Coalition, Greens opposition to government's reforms
item.description: The man tasked with reviewing Australia's environment laws back when the opposition leader was minister, says he is "bitterly disappointed" she is pushing back on the reforms.

item.title: Authorities identify homemade foods believed to be linked to Queensland rat poisoning cluster
item.description: Queensland Health says three of the five people who presented to hospital with brodifacoum poisoning last week consumed two homemade dishes which later tested positive to the toxin.

item.title: Indy Tahau breaks AFLW goal-kicking record as Port upsets Adelaide by seven points
item.description: Indy Tahau breaks the AFLW home-and-away season goal-kicking record in Port's breakthrough seven-point defeat of Adelaide.

item.title: US warns of more killings as it strikes another alleged drug-running boat in the Caribbean
item.description: The frequency of the strikes has increased from one every few weeks in September to three in one week now.

item.title: Albanese heads to summit where Asia's response to Trump's tariffs is on full display
item.description: The unintended consequences of Donald Trump's tariffs may be the exact opposite of what was intended: closer links between ASEAN countries and China, and the creation of an even bigger manufacturing hub in south-east Asia.

item.title: Sussan Ley is Labor's best bet on environmental laws as deal with Greens carries risk
item.description: If the Coalition is indeed the living corpse it so often resembles, Watt and his boss Anthony Albanese will have little choice but to sit down with the Greens, a party they often seem to loathe even more than the Liberals, and do a deal.

item.title: Hamas will disarm but only if a Palestinian state is promised, spokesperson says
item.description: Hamas has quickly re-established de facto control of much of Gaza since the recent ceasefire. But a spokesperson says the militant group does not want to govern Gaza into the future.

item.title: Spring rain on the horizon for Australia's weather as La Niña battles Antarctic warming
item.description: A predicated wetter-than-normal season has failed to materialise, and much of NSW, Queensland and the NT are sweating through their hottest October on record.

item.title: OnlyFans 'sugar daddy' and his wife embroiled in $61 million tax mischief
item.description: A Gold Coast house purchased for an OnlyFans creator by a small-town businessman is among 20 properties frozen by the Federal Court in a $61 million tax case.

item.title: Our country's 50,000-year-old encyclopedia
item.description: There are more than 2 million artworks on the rocks at Murujuga, with more stories under the waves.

item.title: Why the 'Prince Andrew problem' is one King Charles 'has to confront'
item.description: In a week where King Charles said he hoped to project unity as a "bulwark against those promoting conflict, division and tyranny", his scandal-ridden brother reigned supreme.

item.title: Air China flight diverted mid-air after passenger's luggage caught fire
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Virgin Australia passengers told to keep power banks in sight after fire on board
item.description: Virgin Australia is reviewing its rules on portable power banks following a mid-air fire on one of its planes.

item.title: Northern Australia warned to prepare as heatwave weekend tipped
item.description: As a "silent killer" blankets large parts of Australia's north this weekend, medical professionals urge people to plan ahead and stay hydrated.

item.title: The Hobart Clinic failed an audit before CEO was fired and board attempted to wind it up, documents show
item.description: Documents obtained by the ABC show a failed audit at Tasmania's only large-scale private mental health facility, claims that staff concerns were ignored, and the lead-up to the departure of its CEO.

item.title: Meet the retiree activists on a mission to tidy the 'mess' of their generation
item.description: From a retired anaesthetist to a garden-loving grandmother, these three older Australians have "stepped up" and into the "exhausting and stressful" protest movement.

item.title: Analysts say gold chasing shares to record highs is eroding its crucial safe haven status
item.description: A major investment bank says gold is following share markets higher. While the precious metal consistently pushes record highs, it suggests the gold price could continue to rise substantially. But what's really at stake?

item.title: Food subsidies set to run dry as second-longest US government shutdown drags on
item.description: The government shutdown is continuing in the US and some of the worst effects are yet to be felt.

item.title: Australia's aerial skiing success down to 'Aussie grit' as Milano-Cortina Winter Olympic Games loom
item.description: Australia excels in the gravity-defying winter sports discipline of aerial skiing, despite not having a single snow facility in the entire country.

item.title: Billionaire fashion CEO Isak Andic met a tragic end. Now his son is an alleged suspect
item.description: It was a regular December day when Isak Andic, the billionaire founder of Spanish fast-fashion label Mango, set out on a hike with relatives through the Montserrat caves near Barcelona.

item.title: Multicultural communities face 'gap' in relevant aged care services — despite new Aged Care Act
item.description: A new Aged Care Act comes into effect in November, but some question if the act will meaningfully address service gaps for culturally and linguistically diverse communities.

item.title: ABC Quote Quiz: Gifts for Trump, unpopular royals, a new-look BOM site and helping skates mate
item.description: They said it, we published it. Can you decipher it? See if you can work out who said what, and why.

item.title: MS is not holding Lynda MacCallum back from staying in the saddle
item.description: Told she would never ride again after a multiple sclerosis diagnosis, horse trainer Lynda MacCallum is still defying the odds seven years later.

item.title: Will Australia's $3bn critical minerals deal with Trump pay off?
item.description: Anthony Albanese and Donald Trump were all smiles as they inked a $3 billion critical minerals deal touted as a good deal for all. But has Australia drawn the short end of the stick?

item.title: The unexpected hurdle meaning a NSW musician is ineligible for a government grant
item.description: Jennifer Hankin was hoping to apply for a NSW government grant program to support local recording artists so she could finally release her EP.

item.title: AI robots enlisted in fight against sea urchin surge along Australia's east coast
item.description: A hidden environmental crisis lurks beneath the crystal clear waters of Australia's east coast as long-spined sea urchins wreak havoc on the coast. Now scientists are trialling a new solution.

item.title: How a billion-dollar dream blew up a friendship between financial advisor Jason Sourasis and AFL star Scott Pendlebury
item.description: Former Magpies skipper Scott Pendlebury has hired one of Australia's most high-profile commercial lawyers to claim millions that he alleges his former confidant misappropriated.

item.title: Nine candidates running for Townsville mayor at postal by-election
item.description: Townsville residents will select from a field of nine candidates at a mayoral by-election next month.

item.title: Russian envoy says Trump, Putin meeting will likely happen 'at a later date'
item.description: A top Moscow official says he believes the US, Ukraine and Russia are close to a "diplomatic solution" on the conflict.

item.title: Lewis Hamilton warns McLaren's Oscar Piastri and Lando Norris to be 'cut-throat' as they chase F1 title
item.description: Seven-time F1 world champion Lewis Hamilton delivers a warning to McLaren teammates Oscar Piastri and Lando Norris: become more "cut-throat" on the track or risk losing the title to the hard-charging Max Verstappen.

item.title: Beachside business owners contemplate future as trade wiped out by roadworks
item.description: Business owners along one of Adelaide's most renowned beachside retail and dining strips are making tough decisions to shut up shop as they fight to survive a perfect storm of downturn.

item.description: After Canberra woman Leesa Mountford's son, Josh Clarke, took his own life at 25, she co-founded grassroots support network I Got You — helping to fill a gap with demand for support services skyrocketing in the past two years.

item.description: For these war veterans, driving fast, noisy cars gives them peace of mind.

item.title: Tasmania remains free of H5 bird flu, but returning migratory birds could pose a risk
item.description: With migratory birds returning to Tasmania during a period of increased bird flu, the chance of the virus affecting the state's coastal areas is on the rise.
